sentences: Ta ei tea maast ega taevast.
Sa magasid kui kott, ei teadnud maast ega taevast.
Ta ei m√§letanud eilsest pidutsemisest maad ega taevast.
context: 'Taevast' is an Estonian adverb used with 'maast' (from earth/ground) to express complete ignorance or lack of awareness. The phrase 'ei teadnud maast ega taevast' literally means 'didn't know from earth nor from heaven' but idiomatically means someone was completely clueless, unaware of anything happening around them, in a deep sleep state, or had no understanding whatsoever of a situation.
